perturbation.original_text: Neither the Franchisor, its Predecessor nor any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Franchisor's principal trademark:     (A) has an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise, antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive practices; or comparable civil or misdemeanor allegations.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither the Franchisor, its Predecessor nor any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Company's principal trademark:     (A) has an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise, antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive practices; or comparable civil or misdemeanor allegations.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Franchisor's principal trademark' to 'Company's principal trademark' introduces uncertainty. It is unclear whether 'Franchisor' and 'Company' are the same entity, potentially leading to confusion about which trademarks are covered under this clause.

perturbation.original_text: Neither the Franchisor, its affiliate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of the disclosure document: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or that obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor held this position in the company or partnership.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither the Franchisor, its associate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of the disclosure document: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or that obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor held this position in the company or partnership.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'affiliate' with 'associate' introduces ambiguity. The legal definition of 'affiliate' is generally well-understood, while 'associate' is vaguer. This could lead to disputes about which entities are included under this bankruptcy clause.

perturbation.original_text: MASTER FRANCHISEE: THE GRILLED CHEESE TRUCK, INC.                 By:           Name:       Title:               Witness
perturbation.changed_text: AUTHORIZED LICENSEE: THE GRILLED CHEESE TRUCK, INC.                 By:           Name:       Title:               Witness
perturbation.explanation: Switching the label from MASTER FRANCHISEE to AUTHORIZED LICENSEE introduces a significant uncertainty. The roles and responsibilities of a 'Master Franchisee' and an 'Authorized Licensee' are different under franchise law and general business practice. It is not clear which agreement is used and enforced between the two labels.
